runs.comm: really full delivery on the middle and leg line, pushed out to wide mid-on region for a single
full in length and outside off stump, Fletcher is beaten, pushing inside the line
And this time he gets the edge. The classic left-armer's delivery, angling away from Fletcher who pokes at it. The edge carries the ball short of second slip
takes a step forward and across to cover for that angling-across movement and drives it to cover
ah! more drama. More confusion from Fletcher. he walked across and suddenly decided to let go this delivery. Too late for that; the ball hit the bat and ran away to third man
simmons has no problem with that delivery moving across. Well so far at least. He shoulders arms and lets the ball go through to the keeper

That looked absolutely plumb! Delivered from round the stumps, it landed on the middle stump line and straightened just about enough to catch Fletcher right in the front. He played well outside the line of that delivery, trying to turn it to the leg side and was hit in middle stump line.
from over the stumps and he pushes this well outside leg stump for a wide
stays back to punch it to mid-off for a single
leans forward to steer this to point region
the quicker delivery, straightening on the middle and off line, Simmons gets back to push it away
leans well forward to dab to short midwicket region for a single
gets forward to defend this close on the off side and thinks about a single but kills that thought as he sees the keeper dash across
Thumpity thump! It was a full delivery on the off and middle stump line and Simmons whacks it up and over mid-on
Feisty! Blasted! He thrust his front foot forward and smoked through the line and over long-on.
from round the stumps this time, just outside the off stump line, defended to the off side
from round the stumps, a length delivery on the middle and leg line, clipped off the pads past square-leg
full in length, on the middle, looking for the lbw, Bravo gets his bat down in an angle, across from the off side and pushes it wide of midwicket. Risky way to play that
slightly slower, on the middle and leg, tucked behind square-leg
whoa! And ooh la la! Simmons rushes down the track and smashes this over the sight screen
turns this past square-leg for a single
beaten outside off stump. It was in the zone outside off stump, Bravo is beaten, poking out at it
gets back to turn it to wide mid-on for a single
quicker one,  down the leg side, rolls off the pad
quicker one again, on the middle and off line, pushed away to mid-off
leans forward to flick a straight drive, yeah flicked that, to the bowler
works this from the middle and leg line to extra cover for a single
Simmons backs away  to the leg side, waits for the short delivery to arrive and smashes it to extra cover boundary
backs away again but doesn't get much room to work with and he punches it to mid-off
around the off stump line, steered with the turn to backward point region
top edges the one-handed sweep! He went down on his knee to play that sweep but the bottom-hand came off. The ball swirled off the edge but lands safely at deep backward square-leg region
in the channel outside off stump, pushed to backward point..
runs this down to third man for a single

ha! Much fun. Simmons had cleared his front foot and wanted to smash this over midwicket boundary. Just one small slip; he didn't connect. It was the slower one and the ball winked at him as it wobbled past him and danced over the middle stump
full in length, on the middle, worked to the wide midwicket region for a quick single
short in length outside off stump, Bravo slaps it through cover point . .. It appeared as if he was trying to play it down the ground but it went through the off side. Ala, Van der Merwe!
In the zone outside off stump line, steered away through vacant slips for a boundary
gets back to cut this full delivery to backward point
flighted slowly, full, on the off and middle line, on driven to long-on
spins away from Simmons who cuts to left of short third man for a single
Crushed! A long hop from Afridi and Bravo pulls it fiercely over square-leg boundary
full length this time and Bravo taps it to cover point
googly from outside off, nudged to on side
goes on with the arm, from round the stumps, and slips past the defensive push and hits the pad. Going down leg, though
quickish arm-ball, skids on towards off stump, Bravo just about manages to chop it to cover point
slower, on the middle, full in length, steered towards backward point
on the middle and off line, guided to backward point
cuts this to deep point region for a single
Whack. it was delivered from round the stumps short of length around off stump, Simmons backed away to cut it really hard to cover boundary
a juicy full delivery outside leg stump and Bravo plays the powerful sweep shot to collect a boundary
eases this to cover point for a single
quicker one this time but Simmons is ready and cuts it through backward point
gets forward to mistime it to point
beaten by the slider! It lands on a length around middle and off and skids away from Bravo, who stabs inside the line
tries to sweep this but it hits the pad
gets back to clip this to deep midwicket region
on the off stump line, pushed out to point region
full delivery and Bravo gets in to a tangle. He was backing away, looking for the cut, but this was not the length for it. he just about manages to stab it away
gets forward, is beaten in flight and almost jabs it back to the bowler.It goes in the air but falls short of the lunging bowler
cuts this away for a single
tucks this behind square-leg and the fielder comes in from the deep to cut it off
pushes this through midwicket region for couple of runs
gets down on his knee to sweep this to the square-leg boundary. neatly done. He found the perfect placement
presses back to bring up his fifty with a punch to long-off. Good innings this. Sammy shouts words of encouragement. This is Simmons' comeback game, mind you and he has looked v positive out there
pushes this to the off side for a single
leans forward to push this to the leg side
slower, short in length and Simmons plays a superb cut shot. he waited on it and cut it really hard to the point boundary. Super cool!
rushes down the track and smashes this to wide long-on boundary. 91 from just over 11 overs.
Loverly hit! Bravo! He sashays down the track and lifted this superbly over wide long-on boundary. And holds his pose. Click !
quicker and shorter and Bravo seemed to be expecting it; he moves back to steer it past backward point
ha! Simmons threatened to move outside leg and hafeez followed him. Simmons moves back in line of stumps and collects a wide! Gully-cricket stuff!
More fun. Simmons thinks he can get another wide like previous delivery and lets this go but this one comes in a touch to hit the pad!
plays the sweep to get the total to 100.
around the off stump line, Bravo mistimes the attempted forcing shot to Afridi at extra cover
quickish delivery on the leg stump line, mistimes the pull shot but will collect a single as the ball wobbles past square-leg
It was a well-pitched up delivery around off stump and Bravo doesn't quite connect well with his forcing lofted on drive. The ball flew up and Umar Akmal settled under it at long-on
quickish arm-ball, moves past the prod to hit the pad, going down leg
turns away from Simmons who guides to backward point

quicker one outside off, Simmons waits on the back foot and cuts it to backward point boundary. it was a quickish delivery but Simmons pressed back so quickly to get into a perfect position for that shot
gets back and across to tap this through midwicket for a single
leans forward to drive it past extra cover for a single.
flighted delivery, fullish, eased away towards long-off and he rushes back for the second run
turns in from outside off, cut away to sweeper cover
leans forward to play the doosra, with the turn to backward point. Simmons signals the doosra action as he runs across!
gets forward to on drive this to long-on
rushes down the track, doesn't reach the pitch of the ball but whips it away aerially towards deep backward square-leg
gets forward to work this through wide midwicket for a single. They think about the second but decide against it.
gets back to steer this to backward point

Simmons is run out! It was run down to left of short third man and they try to steal a single. Wahab Riaz with the throw and Salman whips off the bails, with Simmons just short of the crease. Very good knock from Simmons is over now. He was full of positive intent today.
leans forward to defend this to the off side
quicker one outside off, short in length, Hyatt waited on the back foot, opened the bat-face and ran it to left of short third man and it races away
a touch slower, fuller as well, guided to left of backward point
short in length around off, pushed back to him
low full toss outside off, that should have been blasted away for a four but the batsman gets an bottom edge and it bounces away to the keeper
a wide delivery outside the off stump, swing and a miss. Wide not given by ump Malcolm.. Hmmm
And Wahab tries again with yet another full and wide delivery outside off. Malcolm is a lenient mood today
closer to the off stump line and Samuels is beaten, poking away from the body
full in length on the off stump line, defended back to the bowler. That's a maiden over! Lucky to get away on two wides but was spot on for the other four deliveries.
slower, on the middle stump line, turning in and Hyatt tries to to slog it to the leg side and doesn't connect. It runs off his pad
moves down the track, reaches the pitch and plays a stylish whippy shot over wide midwicket boundary.
much slower in the air, the top spinner and Hyatt is beaten, trying to steer it to third man
goes for the sweep, misses and it runs off the pad to square-leg. It would have missed the leg stump

Salman stumps Samuels! It was the doosra outside off and Samuels, who went down the track, missed it completely. he went inside the line and the ball wobbled away. Salman didn't collect it cleanly but took it on the rebound and then breaks the stumps
leans forward to push this to point for a single

More joy for Salman. It was a length delivery outside off and Sammy flashes at it and gets the edge. Simple chance, straightforward catch, for Salman. He has taken part in a run out, done a stumping although he didn't collect the ball cleanly on first attempt, and now a easy catch.
around off stump, steered to point
short in length outside off, tries to pull but mistimes it to mid-off
full in length outside off, pushed towards mid-off for a single
steers this shortish delivery to third man for a single
Stop the press! Ump malcolm calls a wide! Well this was a really a way ward delivery outside off
fullish delivery outside off, driven towards right of long-off for couple of runs
doosra outside off, shoved away towards long-off
works this through midwicket for a single
Doosra outside off and the batsman tries to play the slog sweep. The ball breaks away from him and he had no chance to connect that
Bosh! this one was on the stumps, another doosra, but Barnwell connects superbly with this. The slog sweep takes the ball soaring over midwicket
sweeps this one for a single. It was a full toss and he would reckon he has wasted that op
gets back, opens his stance but this doosra is not only short but also keeps a touch low outside off. Hyatt connected with the bottom of his bat and holed out to long-on
in the zone outside off, swing and a miss.
And again. He backs away and tries to slog this over the off but no wood on leather
Done in by the bouncer. he was late on the pull and mistimed it to deep midwicket
wide outside off stump and even Malcolm has to extend his arms
doesn't connect properly with the pull and will get a single to midwicket. There is a direct at the non-striker's end but the batsman was home
he fetched it from outside off and smashed the full delivery to the straight boundary. Crashed!
Wide wide delivery outside off but it's a no ball first. Free hit coming up
fullish, lifted to left of long-on for couple of runs
